Article Title: 2026 World Cup: Scotland end 26-year drought; Spain, Belgium, Switzerland and Austria seal qualification
Article Text:
Scotland's Kieran Tierney celebrates scoring his sides third goal with his teammates (Andrew Milligan/PA via AP)

Kieran Tierney and Kenny McLean scored spectacular injury-time goals to give Scotland a dramatic 4-2 victory over Denmark on Tuesday, sealing their qualification for the 2026 World Cup. Spain also confirmed their spot after a 2-2 draw with Turkey. Belgium joined them with a 7-0 demolition of Liechtenstein, while Switzerland and Austria both secured their places after picking up draws. All five nations will feature at the tournament in the United States, Canada and Mexico next year.Scotland’s late surge in Glasgow ensured Steve Clarke’s team reached the World Cup for the first time since 1998. With the match tied at 2-2 beyond the 90th minute, Denmark were on course to progress as Group C winners until Tierney curled in a superb long-range strike three minutes into stoppage time. McLean settled the contest deep into added time, lofting the ball over Kasper Schmeichel from the halfway line in the 98th minute after spotting the Danish goalkeeper far off his line.“That just sums up this squad,” captain Andy Robertson told the BBC. “Never say die. We just keep going right to the end and one of the craziest games. We put the country through it, but I’m sure it’s worth it. We’re going to the World Cup.”Scotland made the perfect start when Scott McTominay scored with an overhead kick in the third minute.Rasmus Hojlund equalised for Denmark from the penalty spot just before the hour, but the visitors were reduced to 10 men soon after when Rasmus Kristensen received a second yellow card. Hampden Park erupted again in the 78th minute as Lawrence Shankland tapped in from close range, only for Patrick Dorgu to level four minutes later. Tierney and McLean then delivered the decisive blows. Denmark now head to Thursday’s draw for the European play-offs, scheduled for March.Switzerland booked their sixth straight World Cup appearance after a 1-1 draw in Pristina against Kosovo. Needing only to avoid a heavy defeat, they stayed in control for most of the match. Ruben Vargas put them ahead early in the second half, before Florent Muslija equalised.Spain, the Euro 2024 champions, also needed to avoid a seven-goal loss in Seville against Turkey and never looked in danger. Dani Olmo opened the scoring, though Deniz Gul and Salih Ozcan found the net for Turkey to hand Spain their first goals conceded in qualifying. Mikel Oyarzabal equalised after the hour to preserve Spain’s unbeaten run. “We wanted to finish with a win and a clean sheet, so it’s bitter-sweet... but we’re happy to qualify for the World Cup,” Olmo told TVE.Austria snatched a place at their first World Cup in 28 years after a 1-1 draw with Bosnia and Herzegovina, thanks to Michael Gregoritsch’s 77th-minute equaliser. Haris Tabakovic’s early strike had threatened to upset Ralf Rangnick’s side before the leveller sent Bosnia into the play-offs. “I can’t believe it; we made it! I have been trying to reach the World Cup for 18 years. Finally now, at the end of my career, we got there. I can’t wait,” said 36-year-old Marko Arnautovic, via UEFA.com.Belgium, semi-finalists in 2018, eased into the World Cup draw with a dominant win in Liege. Jeremy Doku scored twice, Charles De Ketelaere added a brace of his own and Hans Vanaken, Brandon Mechele and Alexis Saelemaekers also found the net. Wales matched that scoreline in Group J, beating North Macedonia 7-1, with Harry Wilson recording a hat-trick from set pieces. North Macedonia will still feature in the play-offs thanks to their Nations League ranking. Romania, who defeated San Marino 7-0, will also head to the play-offs after finishing third in Group H, and Sweden secured their own spot with a 1-1 draw against Slovenia.The European play-offs will feature 16 teams and offer four additional berths for next year’s World Cup in North America.
Article Summary: Kieran Tierney and Kenny McLean scored spectacular injury-time goals to give Scotland a dramatic 4-2 victory over Denmark on Tuesday. Spain also confirmed their spot after a 2-2 draw with Turkey. Belgium joined them with a 7-0 demolition of Liechtenstein, while Switzerland and Austria both secured their places after picking up draws. All five nations will feature at the tournament in the United States, Canada and Mexico next year.

Article Title: 'He felt superior': English female football referee says coach 'manhandled' her; complaint led to job lost
Article Text:
Photo/Social media

A Women's Super League referee Lisa Benn told a London employment tribunal that she lost her international position after reporting that a referee coach pushed her during a game in March 2023. She claimed the Professional Game Match Officials Limited (PGMOL) gave her lower recommendations after she complained about coach Steve Child's conduct, BBC reported.The incident occurred at a PGMOL tournament focused on video assistant referee (VAR) training. After a delay due to an injury, Benn says Child grabbed her arm and pushed her onto the pitch to start a game.During the match, Child told a fourth official to instruct Benn to "kill the game." Benn responded by saying "don't tell me how to referee" and used an expletive towards Child."I am a trusted referee, I referee at the highest level - this was an under-19s game," Benn told the panel."He felt superior, he felt like he could come on and tell me how to referee, he manhandled me on to the field of play - he would never have done that to a male referee," she stated.When questioned if she had witnessed Child behaving similarly with other referees, Benn responded: "I have to female referees, yes.I haven't to male referees."Benn claims Child approached her after the game, grabbed her arm and said "your card has been marked.""He was so angry his eyes were bulging out of his head," she told the tribunal, as cited by BBC.PGMOL's representative Jesse Crozier suggested Child may have simply guided her to the pitch, but Benn rejected this explanation.Crozier stated: "If you had been dragged, grabbed and pushed at a training tournament with dozens and dozens of people, someone would have seen it." Benn disagreed with this assessment.A PGMOL investigation determined Child's actions did not warrant disciplinary measures. Benn claims that while PGMOL's chief refereeing officer Howard Webb and his wife Bibiana Steinhaus-Webb, then head of women's referees, assured her she would not face consequences for reporting the incident, the organization subsequently reduced their support for her.Benn states this reduced support resulted in her losing a position on FIFA's international referee list.The tribunal proceedings are ongoing.
Article Summary: Lisa Benn told a London employment tribunal that she lost her international position after reporting that a referee coach pushed her during a game in March 2023. She claimed the Professional Game Match Officials Limited (PGMOL) gave her lower recommendations after she complained about coach Steve Child's conduct. A PGMOL investigation determined Child's actions did not warrant disciplinary measures.

Article Title: Mbappe vs PSG explodes into a €700 million war: Unpaid wages, harassment claims and 'loyalty betrayal' at heart of legal showdown
Article Text:
File Pic: Kylian Mbappe (Getty Image)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Poll Who do you think is in the right in the PSG vs Kylian Mbappe feud? Kylian Mbappe Paris Saint-Germain Both sides equally Neither side is right

The long-simmering feud between Paris Saint-Germain and Kylian Mbappe erupted into a full-blown legal and financial battle on Monday as both sides arrived at an industrial court with staggering monetary demands — together exceeding €700 million.The French superstar, who joined Real Madrid on a free transfer in the summer of 2024, claims PSG owes him more than €260 million. This includes unpaid wages, bonuses, severance, and damages, all stemming from his argument that his fixed-term contract should be reclassified as a permanent one — a technical shift that would entitle him to compensation for unfair dismissal.Mbappe had earlier demanded €55 million in unpaid wages. His new claim now encompasses much more, including allegations of moral harassment, undeclared work, and breaches of PSG's duty of good faith and workplace safety.“Kylian Mbappe is not asking for anything beyond what the law provides; he is simply seeking the enforcement of his legal rights, as any employee would,” his advisers said in a statement. The forward did not attend the hearing in person.PSG responded with an even larger counter-claim: €440 million. The club argues that Mbappe's refusal to extend his contract — while also rejecting a €300 million offer from Saudi side Al-Hilal in 2023 — cost them a massive “loss of opportunity” to secure a record transfer fee. The Ligue 1 champions also seek compensation for alleged breaches of good faith, reputational harm, and image damage.The club said it presented evidence that Mbappe acted “disloyally” by hiding his decision not to extend his contract for nearly a year — from July 2022 to June 2023 — leaving PSG powerless to negotiate a transfer.PSG further accused the striker of reneging on an August 2023 agreement involving a salary reduction should he leave on a free transfer. Mbappe's camp insists such an agreement never existed, and says PSG failed to provide proof.The forward has also accused the club of “lofting” — a French term describing the isolation of a player from the main squad. Mbappe was excluded from the preseason tour to Japan and South Korea and initially left out of Ligue 1's opening match after informing the club he would not trigger his extension clause.PSG has denied any harassment or mistreatment, insisting Mbappe featured in “more than 94%” of official matches that season under a coach who went on to win the Champions League.The court's ruling is expected next month, with both sides bracing for one of football's most financially explosive verdicts.
Article Summary: Kylian Mbappe claims PSG owes him more than €260 million. PSG responded with an even larger counter-claim: €440 million. Court's ruling is expected next month, with both sides bracing for one of football's most financially explosive verdicts.

Article Title: Germany and Netherlands storm into 2026 FIFA World Cup with goal-fests
Article Text:
With electrifying performances, Germany and the Netherlands have clinched their World Cup berths. Germany showcased sheer dominance, obliterating Slovakia 6-0, while the Netherlands made a statement with a resounding 4-0 victory over Lithuania. Their offensive firepower has set the stage for an exhilarating global tournament.

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

Poll Which team do you believe has the best chance of winning the World Cup in 2026? Germany Netherlands France Brazil

Germany and the Netherlands sealed their World Cup berths in emphatic fashion on Monday, producing goal-laden performances in their final European qualifying matches to underline their status as major contenders for next year’s global showpiece in the United States, Canada and Mexico.Julian Nagelsmann’s Germany destroyed Slovakia 6-0 in Leipzig, while Ronald Koeman’s Netherlands swept past Lithuania 4-0 in Amsterdam. Both teams needed only a draw to secure qualification but showed zero appetite for caution.“Every player played well today and worked like a dog,” Nagelsmann told German broadcaster ZDF after his side overwhelmed Group A rivals. Four-time world champions Germany, level on points with Slovakia before kick-off, seized command early. Nick Woltemade headed the opener in the 18th minute, and once Serge Gnabry doubled the lead, the hosts never looked back. Leroy Sane struck twice before half-time, with Ridle Baku and Assan Ouedraogo completing the rout after the break.“We’re relieved. It’s a great moment,” a jubilant Woltemade told ZDF. “I’m playing, I’m scoring goals and I’m hopefully playing at the World Cup.”Elsewhere in Group A, Northern Ireland beat Luxembourg 1-0 but remained third.However, their Nations League ranking guarantees them a place in March’s 16-team European play-offs.In Amsterdam, the Netherlands delivered a high-tempo masterclass that thrilled more than 50,000 fans. Lithuania were pinned deep from the start, with Tijani Reijnders finishing off a neat move initiated by Frenkie de Jong to open the scoring. A superb first-half display by goalkeeper Edvinas Gertmonas delayed the inevitable, but Cody Gakpo’s 58th-minute penalty unlocked the floodgates. Xavi Simons and Donyell Malen struck in quick succession as Koeman’s men cruised.Reijnders, who did not debut until after the 2022 Qatar World Cup, savoured the moment. “I watched it at home, on the couch, with my Oranje shirt on,” he said. “This time it’s going to be very different for me… I’m really looking forward to taking part for the first time.”In other matches, Croatia—already assured of Group L’s top spot—fought back to beat Montenegro 3-2, while the Czech Republic thrashed Gibraltar 6-0. Poland survived a scare in Malta, edging out a chaotic 3-2 encounter but finishing second in Group G behind the Dutch.
Article Summary: Germany and the Netherlands have clinched their World Cup berths. Germany thrashed Slovakia 6-0 in Leipzig, while Ronald Koeman’s Netherlands swept past Lithuania 4-0. Northern Ireland beat Luxembourg 1-0 but remained third in Group A.

Article Title: Faster US visas? President Donald Trump unveils 'FIFA Pass' to help 2026 World Cup travellers
Article Text:
President Donald Trump speaks (AP Photo/Alex Brandon)

The Trump administration has unveiled a new program called "FIFA Pass" to expedite visa interviews for international visitors attending the 2026 FIFA World Cup . This initiative will facilitate faster visa appointment scheduling for individuals who have purchased World Cup tickets through FIFA.The program aims to balance strict immigration policies while accommodating the anticipated surge of international travellers for the soccer tournament. The term "pass" in the program name represents "prioritised appointments scheduling system.""If you have a ticket for the World Cup, you can have prioritised appointments to get your visa. You said it the very first time we met, Mr. President, America welcomes the world," said FIFA President Gianni Infantino during his Oval Office meeting with Trump."I strongly encourage World Cup travellers to the U.S. to apply for their visas right away," Trump said Monday.The State Department has deployed over 400 additional consular officers globally to manage visa applications. Currently, about 80 percent of global travellers can secure a visa appointment within 60 days.The new system allows ticket holders who purchased through FIFA to access a special portal for expedited visa application processing and interview scheduling with the State Department."We're going to do the same vetting as anybody else would get. The only difference here is we're moving them up in the queue," said Secretary of State Marco Rubio The World Cup will feature 104 matches across Canada, Mexico, and the United States. Trump has prioritised the tournament's success, with Infantino making frequent White House visits ahead of the December 5 World Cup draw at the Kennedy Center.Trump discussed the possibility of relocating World Cup matches from Seattle, one of the 11 U.S. host cities, citing concerns about the election of progressive activist Katie Wilson as mayor and the city's sanctuary status for migrants."If we think there's gonna be sign of any trouble, I would ask Gianni to move that to a different city," Trump said regarding Seattle."I think safety and security is the number one priority for a successful World Cup. We can see today that people have trust in the United States," Infantino responded, highlighting strong ticket sales while avoiding direct comments about relocating host cities.
Article Summary: Trump administration unveils "FIFA Pass" to expedite visa interviews for international visitors attending the 2026 FIFA World Cup. Program aims to balance strict immigration policies while accommodating the anticipated surge of international travellers for the soccer tournament. The term "pass" in the program name represents "prioritised appointments scheduling system"

Article Title: Camp Nou breathes again as Barcelona set to walk back into their home of stories on November 22
Article Text:
Barcelona's players exercise during the team's first training session at the venue after its renovation at the Camp Nou stadium in Barcelona, Spain, Friday, Nov. 7, 2025. (AP Photo)

Spanish football club Barcelona will return to the rebuilt Camp Nou on November 22 for their La Liga match against Athletic Bilbao, the club announced on Monday. This will be their first game at the stadium in more than two years.Camp Nou was closed at the end of the 2022/23 season, and Barcelona have since played their home matches mainly at the Olympic Stadium on Montjuic.More than 20,000 people paid to watch the team practice at the Camp Nou on Nov. 7.Work began on upgrading the stadium in June 2023 to expand capacity in Europe’s largest soccer venue that previously stood at 99,000.The reconstruction project, worth 1.5 billion euros ($1.75 billion), faced delays and is reopening a year later than planned.For now, the stadium will operate with a temporary capacity of 45,401. When the top tier is finished, it will hold 105,000 spectators. As part of the reopening process, Barcelona allowed 23,000 fans to attend a training session earlier in November.The club is also waiting for UEFA approval to host Eintracht Frankfurt at Camp Nou on December 9 in the Champions League.At the start of this season, Barcelona had to play two matches at the 6,000-capacity Johan Cruyff Stadium after they did not receive the required safety permit for Camp Nou.Barcelona plan to install a roof on the new stadium in the summer of 2027, a year later than originally planned.
Article Summary: Barcelona will return to the rebuilt Camp Nou on November 22 for their La Liga match against Athletic Bilbao. This will be their first game at the stadium in more than two years. Camp Nou was closed at the end of the 2022/23 season, and Barcelona have since played their home matches mainly at the Olympic Stadium on Montjuic.

Article Title: Isaac Rochell's wife Allison Kuch's genuine reaction to Ja'Marr Chase's spitting incident leaves fans surprised
Article Text:
Isaac Rochell and Allison Kuch with their baby (Image via: Isaac Rochell's IG)

Allison Kuch’s surprised guesses reveal how shocking the fine truly was

Former Las Vegas Raiders defensive end Isaac Rochell and his wife Allison Kuch unintentionally delivered one of the week’s most striking reaction videos after she discovered the enormous $507,156 fine handed to Cincinnati Bengals star Ja’Marr Chase. The penalty, issued for spitting on Pittsburgh Steelers cornerback Jalen Ramsey, was revealed to Kuch during a casual Instagram video that quickly became a viral talking point. Her genuine confusion and disbelief reflected how unexpectedly large the fine was, even for people familiar with NFL discipline. The clip resonated with fans because it showcased an unfiltered, real-time reaction to a punishment that many already viewed as unusually severe.Rochell set the stage in the video by asking Kuch, “You know how much Ja'Marr Chase got fined?” before explaining, “Chase spit on somebody. Keep in mind, this is two grown men arguing and he spit on somebody.” Kuch immediately tried connecting it to real-world consequences and said, “I’m pretty sure that’s like a… Like if that happened down the street, you could get jail time, right? Isn’t that like harassment?” Her comparison underscored how the act felt more serious outside a football setting and helped the moment gain momentum online.Kuch began guessing modestly with $20,000 and $30,000, only for Rochell to keep urging her to “keep going.” She pushed upward to $40,000 and then $100,000, each time surprised that the number still wasn’t close. Her guesses eventually climbed to $150,000, $200,000, $300,000, $400,000 and even $500,000 as the disbelief on her face grew. When she joked, “That better be a good ball of spit,” Rochell added the punchline, “That better be a good hock to it,” moments before revealing, “He almost got fined $600,000. ”After the shock settled, Rochell brought up his own past fine to lighten the moment further. “My wife got mad at me because I got fined $5,000 for my socks,” he said, only for Kuch to correct him with, “$7,000.” The contrast between a sock fine and a half-million-dollar spitting penalty gave the clip an extra comedic edge. Officials reviewed footage from the Nov. 16 Bengals-Steelers game and confirmed that Chase spit at Ramsey during the fourth quarter. His one-game suspension for Week 12 was upheld by appeals officer Jordy Nelson following the review. Article Title: Justin Tucker to the 49ers? Kyle Shanahan finally addresses the speculation after Eddy Piñeiro’s injury shakes up San Francisco
Article Text:
The San Francisco 49ers are facing a kicker crisis after Eddy Piñeiro sustained a hamstring injury. Coach Kyle Shanahan has confirmed the team has not considered signing legendary kicker Justin Tucker. The 49ers are exploring other options for a temporary replacement. Piñeiro's injury comes at a critical time for the team's playoff push.

Why Kyle Shanahan says the 49ers have not discussed bringing in Justin Tucker

Kyle Shanahan Conference Call: 49ers injury updates day after Week 11 win vs. Cardinals

The San Francisco 49ers can’t seem to escape the injury cycle this season, and their latest setback has sparked one of the most unexpected questions of the year: could legendary kicker Justin Tucker be on the team’s radar? The buzz exploded after Eddy Piñeiro strained his right hamstring during the 49ers’ 41–22 win over the Arizona Cardinals, leaving fans and analysts wondering whether San Francisco might consider the seven-time Pro Bowler as a short-term solution.Tucker, who spent 13 seasons with the Baltimore Ravens, remains one of the most accomplished kickers in NFL history. But when Kyle Shanahan finally addressed the rumors, his response made one thing very clear.When asked directly about the team exploring Tucker as an option, Shanahan didn’t hesitate. “No. We haven’t talked about that,” he told 49ers Webzone. The follow-up question didn’t change much. “I have no idea. I haven’t talked about one kicker with them, so not sure about anyone. I know they’re putting together a group of guys to possibly bring in Tuesday or Wednesday.”The idea of Tucker joining San Francisco is tempting for fans. Even after a down season where he posted a 73.3% field-goal percentage, his career numbers, 89.1% overall and a record-setting 66-yard kick, speak for themselves. But Tucker’s situation is complicated.He missed 10 games this year due to a suspension tied to an alleged violation of the Personal Conduct Policy, and despite expressing interest in returning to the field, he has not yet visited any team.With Shanahan confirming no internal discussions about Tucker, the 49ers are turning elsewhere. Names reportedly in the mix include John Parker Romo, recently waived by the Atlanta Falcons, and Matt Gay, who became available after the Commanders released him. The irony is that former Niners kicker Jake Moody, who was replaced by Piñeiro earlier this season, is no longer an option, Washington picked him up from the Bears’ practice squad.Piñeiro’s injury comes at a brutal time. He opened the season by setting a franchise record for 17 straight makes and had converted all 22 field-goal attempts. Shanahan praised him earlier this year, saying, “He’s been awesome so far. Pumped that we’ve been able to get him.”Now week-to-week with a Grade 1 hamstring strain, Piñeiro joins a growing list of injured players, including linebacker Tatum Bethune. As the 49ers fight to maintain momentum in the NFC West, the search for a reliable fill-in kicker begins, but for now, Justin Tucker isn’t part of that conversation.Also Read: Ja’Marr Chase’s bizarre excuse for spitting on Jalen Ramsey fuels heated league-wide debate as suspension appeal looms
